intro: Mollugo umbellata, commonly known as the common sandwort, is a small flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal areas or disturbed habitats. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers arranged in umbels, which are clusters of flowers emerging from a single point. Its leaves are usually fleshy and succulent, adapted to retain moisture in arid environments. Mollugo umbellata is a low-growing perennial that thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight.
